website_summaries.verdict: The HP Officejet Pro 8500 wireless makes a convincing inkjet argument for offices with a high volume of prints. With a function touch screen, multiple networking options, and an astoundingly fast print speed, it makes perfect sense to give this workhorse an Editors' Choice award.
pros: easy to use 3.4-inch LCD touch screen
cons: Lacks autodial fax buttons, Bluetooth, and a dual paper input tray

customer_reviews.title: Stay clear of this NOISY ink drinking mediocre printer!
customer_reviews.text: This has lost of issues! The ink runs out very fast and after 2 refills you almost bought the printer again! LoL Tons of software issues doesn't print very well specially color pictures! You want to talk about noisy...this is the loudest printer I have ever owned, and it has a constant ring/humming noise coming from it when not in use...You don't want to leave this on unless you use it or it'll will drive you nuts! I bought myself one and one for my mom for xmas...My mother complains to me about it all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Baumann

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and effective
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for several years now, and it has worked very well. I bought this when the university I was attending implemented a policy requiring students to pay per page printed. I did the math, and with ink and paper, I projected I would break even on the cost of purchasing this to print at home within three semesters. That was undergrad; I'm halfway through a Ph.D. and my partner went back to school too, and the printer is still doing a great job. It's definitely cheaper to print at home, even in color, than to pay what our current universities charge to print.
customer_reviews.author: Horatio Cornblower

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, but not perfect - no regrets
customer_reviews.text: I bought this all in one wireless to upgrade an old HP deskjet 5150 and a separate brother fax machine. Needed wifi to be able to easily use from multiple computers in the home. The setup was no harder than other wifi devices (=mildly challenging), and it works very well. In about a month of use, it has jammed once, and lost the wifi connection once also. Real, but not terrible annoyances. The print quality is excellent, and it is a lot faster than the older machine it replaces. I would recommend it for home/home office use. Good functionality at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin M. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Solid Scanner, Used too much ink
customer_reviews.text: The greatest feature of this printer for me, was the ability to scan in PDF format directly onto network shares. As a color printer it was fine, but over time began to streak. It uses way too much ink just booting. The Media Card slots worked very well, both to print form the printer, and to read the cards over the network. The interface was relatively intuitive and overall it was a solid printer. It was simply wasteful of ink and it's printing quality degraded quickly after about a year or so.
customer_reviews.author: N. Ternullo

customer_reviews.title: HP Officejet Pro 8500 Wireless
customer_reviews.text: We've had this unit for about two months now. It works okay. The copy and print functions work well. It doesn't feed the paper very good, it will have a mispick every so often, to the point that we are considering getting it warrantied. It seems to send and receive faxes well. The noise factor is a little more than average, not really bad but it is more than we expected. The scanning also works well for as much as we have done, we've scanned to email and to files, though in limited amounts. Overall we haven't used this enough yet to have really firmed up our opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Ron And Kay Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful printer and all-in-one
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from an older model of this printer and this is a much better all-in-one unit. I love the touch screen and the options I get with it. Much easier to use than the model it replaced. My only complaint is that on occasion I am told it is out of paper and I discover that there is plenty of paper still left in the paper tray. I am using the automatic two-sided copying a lot.... makes my life easier. All in all a great all-in-one unit. And the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Printer
customer_reviews.text: Great all in one printer. I purchased this one to replace an older model of an HP all in one. This new one takes up less desk space and works better than the older one, the individual ink cartridges are great at making all the ink go so much further. It amazes me as to the quantity of papers I can print before any individual ink cartridge has to be changed. Definately a money saver when it comes to re-purchasing ink. I also like the sleep mode the printer goes into when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: 4u2

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: Everything worked great until one of their updates. After that, I've never been able to connect wirelessly again. I've uninstalled/reinstalled current and old versions of their software and the wireless is dead in the water. I'm a programmer and even I can't figure this one out. So...I had to resort to using the wired version, which defeats the purpose of buying a *wireless* item ;) Everything else has worked perfectly thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Zyde

customer_reviews.title: Good machine-bad print heads
customer_reviews.text: The printer itself is great. The OCR program allows me to scan and edit. Same model I have at my office. This particular machine needed new printer heads. It prints in black and white but color printing is miserable at best. I spent about $150.00 on Amazon to purchase the two bad printer heads.
customer_reviews.author: drperio

customer_reviews.title: Should have been recalled!
customer_reviews.text: Never worked right. Feeder tray never scanned documents straight. Out of ink error would intermittently lock up all functionality and was never resolved. I would replace the cartridges, but it would still say I was out of ink. Customer support would said that I needed to reflash firmware, which was more complicated than an average user would be able to do, but it did not work. Tried cleaning all contacts to no avail. After fighting with it for a year, the warranty ran out they would not replace. POS.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Lum

customer_reviews.title: Solid Printer
customer_reviews.text: Solidly constructed, good scanner, good print quality, good cost per page and excellent user interface. The wireless was a breeze to set up. The printer does make some noise as the printhead sets up and the paper goes along it's path. However, what do you expect with the rated printed speeds of 35ppm? If you want a solid printer with low running costs, simple user interface, good print and scan quality and easy wireless interaction look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Boy

customer_reviews.title: 1st-rate printer with 3rd world support.
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful printer until it has problems. Call centers staffed by people with shaky English do not seem to remotely live up HP's former standards. I've bought HP printers for over 30 years at work and at home, in several countries.
customer_reviews.author: S. Elliott

customer_reviews.title: don't buy this product
customer_reviews.text: This product is poor in almost every category. I just bought a new HP laptop so I thought this product would be a good complement. Wrong. Where to start? - Automatic Paper feeder did not work out of the box - Setup took about an hour - Loads all kinds of other software that you don't want Save yourself some hassle. Buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Fidler

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  The best All-in-one I've Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: I've been purchasing HP printers since my first DeskJet over 15 years ago. Some have been very good and one or two had some major problems. However the OfficeJet Pro 8500 Wireless is the best one yet! The set-up was without a hitch - and I have both XP and Vista machines. The scan feature works perfectly and converts directly to PDF files. Print quality is great. And the fax and fax options make it a complete solution! You can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: John K. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I have had the HP Officejet Pro 8500 A909g for about 2 weeks now and it works well. I have had some problems with the software suite the they offer with it. Scanning epically, very slow so I use Paint much faster. When I installed the printer I download the latest version of the software V13. The Disk that cam with it had V9. This is common as they take a year or so to get most of the bugs out. Save yourself some time and headaches by downloading the latest version. So for now I am happy I got a good price on last years model with most recent software/drivers.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W Baker Jr

customer_reviews.title: HP 8500 wireless printheads don't work
customer_reviews.text: HP 8500 wireless shipment arrived and setup was straightforward but the printheads are nonfunctioning. HP tech support is sending new printheads (been waiting three weeks now) and if printheads don't work then I get to send the printer to them for replacement. I'm hoping to be able to have a working printer 60 days after ordering it.
customer_reviews.author: Ed J. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Too much plastic inside....
customer_reviews.text: Had this printer only 6 months and it started making noises and now carriage won't move. There is a little piece of a plastic part laying under where the carriage goes back and forth. It broke off from somewhere. HP says it can't be fixed. What a joke of a printer! Says it will handle up to 15,000 sheets a month, crap, I have only printed about 500 in 6 months and it is already dead!
customer_reviews.author: hale-yes

customer_reviews.title: Never had software to work with my machine.  Continual problem buy the 8600 instead or the 6700 they are better.
customer_reviews.text: Never had software to work with my machine. Continual problem buy the 8600 instead or the 6700 they are better. I still buy HP Printers, but sometimes they have a bad one, this got caught between, xp and windows 7, just has never worked right thinking about dumping it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: New HP Officejet Pro 8500
customer_reviews.text: I'm still pretty new to this printer, but set up on my home Wi-Fi was easy, even with WPA authentication. It has a handy energy saving turn off after idle feature that I wish my old Epson had. Home members were constantly forgetting to turn off the printer to let the print head seat properly and cartridges would dry up. I haven't had it long enough to know about reliability and how the cartridge use will compare to the Epson's I've had previously, but it appears that all of the regularly accessible things (changing cartridges, adding paper) are laid out well and easily accessible. The primary user at home already likes it head over heals above what we had.
customer_reviews.author: Craig A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: review of hp 8500 printer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the printer through amazon at a very fair price. The printer has a jam indicator and has not worked from the start . I have put requests in to find out what to do w amazon, or to see if the vendor can replace with another unit or refund. I prefer the replacement with a unit that works. Not sure what to do at this point. I will try and call and send emails to amazon again to see what can be done. Otherwise if nothing can be done, then I consider this a waste of money, as well as a waste of 3 weeks of time. Tony D. 10-21-2013
customer_reviews.author: Tony Di Trolio

customer_reviews.title: Printer won't align, uses way to much ink
customer_reviews.text: Print head won't align. Always prints a second sheet of paper with color blocks on it. Uses alot more ink then my other HP, same model but older. Prints very slow
customer_reviews.author: Byron Peregrim

customer_reviews.title: Good idea - bad execution
customer_reviews.text: I got this HP all-in-one to replace a still working older model. The plan was to add the fax and feeder functionality to scan more and multi-page documents, but the feeder is total junk and rarely if ever functions (and when it does is vvvvverryyy slow). Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: M. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best printers that HP has designed.
customer_reviews.text: I have had a few older HP printers and found this one to be the BEST printer that HP has designed in years. I have owned if for over a year and would recommend it to anyone looking for an All in One printer. No problems with this unit. Dependable
customer_reviews.author: Tom M.

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay connected
customer_reviews.text: The printer has all the features I wanted. I loved it at first. But the printer will not stay connected to a wireless OR wired network. Based on feedback I've seen on the HP support forum, XP users won't have an issue. Vista and Windows 7 (like me) users will suffer. It's a shame, the printer is fine, it's the software achieving the failing grade. After HOURS on the phone with HP Support, and escalations to executives, and emailing, I am shipping the printer back.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Nice Printer
customer_reviews.text: Nice Printer I have had several HP printers and have been happy with them all. I just tossed out a Epson Artisan 800 which was a money hungry my mistake for buying it.. junk. The only thing I can complain about is the software insulation had to re do it several times before things worked right.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: only lasted about a year
customer_reviews.text: this thing is kinda crappy. by now it is out of date so this review is probably useless. but just in case .... ours only lasted about a year and a couple months - then we replaced it. the prints sucked and it was always crapping out or something
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made product---Parts break and there are no replacements available---Recommend---DO NOT ! Buy......
customer_reviews.author: TOM  W.

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: After a few months I keep getting the error message replace ink cartridge. Replaced it with 2 different new oem HP cartrides.. still doesnt work. HP support stinks. Printer is going in the trash. Will not buy hp again
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: We have not been disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: When my original 8500 Pro's print heads broke after YEARS of daily usage, I knew I wanted another one because of the quality! We have not been disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: LMac

customer_reviews.title: A great wireless all in one
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how long I've had this printer, but it is great. I use it every day -- copying, printing, scanning. Although it does have a fax use that feature.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma B

customer_reviews.title: The poor reviews of this printer accurately reflect my experiences
customer_reviews.text: This printer is extraordinarily unreliable. It requires constant rebooting as the powersave feature doesn't work properly. Paper jams all the time. When paper isn't jammed, it generates jam messages anyway. It takes forever to print the first page. I never could get the wireless to work. I have never written a review before, but the lackluster performance of this expensive printer moved me to write one for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: SZ2000

customer_reviews.title: Drove me nuts.....! But now I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I am not anywhere near a tech savvy person.It took a while to figure out the WiFi password setup.Only because I am very impatient and wrongfully think it will magically open.No fault of HP AT ALL.Do not fear.It was eventually done by my tv/phone/internet provider for free. Now I love it Print is so good!
customer_reviews.author: Gwen Muhlig

customer_reviews.title: Quality Printer
customer_reviews.text: Short review here. Great quality, speed, and functions. I have used and like the double side printing capability. Wireless internet connectivity is flawless and easy to set up. Two laptop computers in house using wireless connections and everything works as perfectly. Faxed many documents and no jams. I have had printer for about 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: my refund
customer_reviews.text: I will change my rating when I get a refund that I sent the printer back
customer_reviews.author: Laurie oberfoell

customer_reviews.title: Engineering malpractice
customer_reviews.text: This is the seventh HP printer I've owned and the one I think is an engineering cripple at birth. For some unknown reason, HP decided it didn't need a pressure plate to hold the paper in place while feeding. At least once on each print job I must get up and go to the printer to push the paper into place due to vibration bouncing it out. Just plain engineering design incompetence. Do not buy any of these series 8500, 6500, 6600 etc.
customer_reviews.author: Roland D. Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome All-In-One Machine
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer. It was easy to set up, the wireless connected immediately to my home network and every step of set up and installation was clearly spelled out in the documentation. I was blown away to get a machine of this quality for $250 with free shipping. A great bargain in my opinion. The only minor issue I have encountered is that you must remove paper from the feed tray and insert envelopes by themselves. You cannot mix output types. But this is a minor inconvenience for me, as I don't do much mailing work.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas May

customer_reviews.title: It seems to be okay
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter for her home office. She did have some trouble getting it set up remotely, but the customer service did help her with that at not charge.
customer_reviews.author: Cultech

customer_reviews.title: HP8500 wireless....
customer_reviews.text: The HP8500 wireless printer is a good supplemental printer. Unfortunately, it was a bear to set up. The installation instructions are seriously lacking in clarity when installing on a Windows 7 system. I had to call HP to get help. Concerning the HP support group, they were great!! The tech spent an hour on the phone making sure that the installation was complete and the printer functioning properly. I'm not that technically adept but I can read and comprehend well written instructions. HP can do a better job with their 'Getting Started" guide.
customer_reviews.author: Gene B.

customer_reviews.title: the worst printer ever !!! broke down after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: HP customer service is the worst !!! The printer broke down exactly 2 month after the warranty expired I called HP customer service and they offered to give me a support over the phone for $20 fee!! that support didn't do much cause the printer still showed an error msg, so I just spent another $20 on a non working printer. Their next best solution is ? "we will give you a $20 credit toward a new HP printer." GREAT!!! the price they offered to give me the printer for was actually $100 more expansive than the price on AMAZON.com. besides why would you buy another HP printer ever again ??? Worst customer service ever!!!
customer_reviews.author: rafi mizrahi

customer_reviews.title: Defective product stopped printing within a week of use.
customer_reviews.text: Had this product only a few days when it stopped working. Would only print sporadically. Had an identical model that worked fine, but this one has never worked right. Am going to follow up on warranty to get it replaced. Disappointed in quality.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Great printer! It does everything as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer approximately 6 weeks ago. It has been working flawlessly. It does everything very well. I have been able to connect all Win 7 machines wirelessly. That's not the case with Win XP, but I am still working on finding a possible solution. The duplex function works as expected. Unlike what was stated in other reviews, the ink consumption is normal. On limited occassions the paper pickup does not work well. All in all, this is a great multifunction printer at a very good price. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JHDTV

customer_reviews.title: gopd huy
customer_reviews.text: Very nice printer. Have two others and wanted the same again so all use the same cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: debra cobb

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: We recently purchased this product for our small business. The paper feed would jamb with the amount of paper that it is supposed to hold. The print quality was terrible, the scan quality was absolutely terrible. It would jamb/freeze for no reason. There was a long delay, the printing was slow, and it was loud. It turned off in the middle of the night causing us to not receive important faxes. Overall, we were very dissatisfied with this purchase, and returned it 3 weeks after purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KAL

customer_reviews.title: So far great product
customer_reviews.text: Only had the printer for about a month but seems do do very well, especially the wireless connection. However I get concerned because the problem with HP is that they don't stay focused on current products and keep changing them leaving them behind. I hate when they do this! They also at times make products that you have to discard especially print heads that are dated to wear out and you are throwing your money away. Hopefully with this model it is different. Beware.....
customer_reviews.author: Jack T. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Best printer I own, but...
customer_reviews.text: Best printer I own but I wish I didn't have to remove printing paper before I print envelopes. This feature is very inconvenient and can be irritating all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Family4Christ

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PRINTER BUT IMPOSSIBLE TO SET IT UP
customer_reviews.text: THE PRINTER WAS VERY DIFFICULT TO SET UP. THE CUSTOMER CARE FROM HP WAS OF NO HELP AT ALL. THEY JUST READ THE MANUAL AND MAKE YOU WAIT. THEY HAD NO IDEA OF HOW TO SOLVE THE PROBLEM IN SETTING UP THE PRINTER. THE DRIVER WOULD NOT DOWNLOAD DUE TO CLASH WITH SOME OTHER PROGRAM. COULD MANAGE TO SETUP WITH HELP OF SOME FRIENDS WHO WERE COMPUTER TECH. BE CAREFUL BEFORE YOU SLECT THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: unhappy
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this all in one printer and already I am having problems with the quality of the copies. I purchased this particular machine because it was recommended to me as the machine to get for my daily use, I frustrated that I have had this machine about one month and already I am having problems. The machine was easy enough to set up but now I will have to hassle with HP about why I am getting long black lines through every copy that I make.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Fast and a Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Fussy about how you load the paper, but otherwise a very good machine for the price. Warms up pretty quickly, and prints very fast. Love the wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren M. Sigman

customer_reviews.title: All I had expected
customer_reviews.text: This came to us on time from Amazon, and was perfect out of the box. Set up was completely as described without hitch, networking was a snap, it is connected by ethernet to our router and we can hit it wirelessly from multiple computers, a real plus). Performance is exactly as represented, and there hasn't been a hiccup since. Costco carries the necessary ink cartridges at a good price, so we're pretty pleased all around.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Annoying small issues prevent this from being a great product
customer_reviews.text: Dislike: paperjams and bent right corner (was able to fix this by pressing down the foam just before the paper exits the printer), loosing connectivity with computer when in wireless mode after a period of inactivity, long cleaning cycles whenever the printer is turned on, inability to keep printing if the printer sensor says you are out of ink. Like: Quick printing, user menu, overall solid look and feel.
customer_reviews.author: J. King

customer_reviews.title: 8500 HP Network Printer User
customer_reviews.text: I have only had the printer for a short time, but so far I really like it. If you follow the instructions it is fairly easy to set up. The features on the printer are great and it is fairly easy to use. So far, I recommend the HP 8500 Pro printer.
customer_reviews.author: Tropical traveler

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer and Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this all-in-one for a scanning project I am working on at triCerat Inc. Great all-in-one! I like the scanning capabilities with one exception: when using the auto document feeder, scans are limited to 300 DPI rather than the glass capability of 2400 DPI. Printer is very fast. I like the wireless feature, very easy to setup and get into my network (my router/wireless access point has AOSS capability, which I used).
customer_reviews.author: MyCodeWorks

customer_reviews.title: Great features - great price
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace an old MFP printer and did a great deal of searching. All my research led to this printer and I couldn't be happier. It was a breeze to set up, has very easy to use features and is a workhorse. The scanning features have been a great organizational tool. I am happy with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L. Paul

customer_reviews.title: worst machine ever
customer_reviews.text: I too have had many Hp all-in-one printers and wireless printers for years with no problems but this was a real lemon. The wireless would go out all of the time, faxes came through some of the time, the paper jammed all of the time and it is really slow. yuck don't buy
customer_reviews.author: AIG

customer_reviews.title: I love our new printer
customer_reviews.text: My husband did not have a problem setting it up (he is very technical). I am the non-technical but I think this one of the best printers out there. Love that it prints so fast and I really don't have a problem with the noise level (as other reviewers have stated. We got a good deal during xmas so it was definitely a good buy. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: T. Isabel

customer_reviews.title: Experience in using printer
customer_reviews.text: Since I started to use it the paper feed is not working properly. Even though the paper tray is full it continuously gives me a message to refill tray and I have to open tray, take paper out, put it back in and then it works for just a few copies then gives message again. Other than this I like the printer. What can I do to resolve this issue?
customer_reviews.author: Blanca N. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer.
customer_reviews.text: Great printer. I always buy HP for printing needs. I bought the Officejet 7410 seven years ago, and it is still working great. My printing needs have increased for my home business, so i decided to buy the newest version from the 7410, and it's the 8500. Great Printer. Double the speed and color accuracy. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: F. Alexis / Small Business Corp. Services

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware...
customer_reviews.text: I had numerous problems setting-up this printer and furthermore the software comes with lots of junk that you don't need. After using the printer for less than one month - I am talking very light use - the printer suddenly stopped communicating with the computers. After being for 3 hours on the phone with the HP representatives they've acknowledged that it's a hardware problem on their printer. However since I bought it on Amazon which apparently is not a direct seller HP is making me pay for the shipping fee; not to talk about the time that I'll be out of a printer in my small business office! Absolutely appalling!
customer_reviews.author: Daniela Ciocan

customer_reviews.title: Never worked printer.
customer_reviews.text: I had problems from day one. When I called for help HP was helpful but I had one problem after the other. Would never buy a HP again.
customer_reviews.author: Joy D

customer_reviews.title: The Worst Purchase I Ever Made
customer_reviews.text: The printer did not work. The paper feed did not pull paper through. There was no user manual. There is no one to call. The printer is too big and bulky to return. Certainly someone knew it was faulty before they put it up for sale. VERY disappointed in this purchase. A waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.author: ed foster

customer_reviews.title: ... to be found Does not work at all -- garbage!!
customer_reviews.text: Does not work says there is paper jam with none to be found Does not work at all -- garbage !!!!
customer_reviews.author: John C. Little

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for just about any job!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent home printer. I have had numerous printers over the years and all of them have been all-in-ones but this is the best yet. It is whisper quiet and prints extremely fast. It prints double sided copies and has the print space for legal size copies. Set up is very easy, 20 minutes from opening the box and the wireless feature clears up all the loose wiring at the back of the printers and on the floor. Overall, a great printer for the money. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: George G.

customer_reviews.title: AVOID THIS PRODUCT LIKE THE PLAGUE
customer_reviews.text: I've been a loyal HP customer for 15 years. This unit is a hunk of garbage. I went through 2 units and both had the same high pitched hissing sound; it's like someone scratching a chalkboard. I also experienced a problem with the ADF scanner. While the ADF would actually scan each page, the resulting document would be short a couple pages. For example, the ADF would scan 10 pages, but the PDF file it created only had 8 pages. Amazon's initial exchange was great. However, after the second one had the same problem, Amazon refused to exchange the item even though HP tech support assured me this was an isolated problem.
customer_reviews.author: RussC

customer_reviews.title: Fine printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer works great, and I am especially fond of its wireless capability. Very good value.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Kuntz

customer_reviews.title: Very good all around printer
customer_reviews.text: The touch screen is very friendly and intuitive and the basic functions of Scanning, Copying and Faxing are done in two to five touches. The printer and scan are very noisy though and somewhat slow and not suitable for a home use if noise is a concern. The wireless connection was a snap and works flawlessly. Overall, I am very pleased with this printer for my small office.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Aviezer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I had owned many HP printers over the years and bought this one based on my past good experiences. However I can tell you that this is just terrible. The printer is VERY LOUD and the paper handleing is HORRIBLE. It often has trouble picking up the paper in the feeder and about every third page is shredded. It is virtually unusable. I strongly recomend you go elsewhere for you printing needs. Huge waste of time and money. Avoid this printer.
customer_reviews.author: SLA

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one I purchased
customer_reviews.text: I am cautious of the paper feed as the first HP I owned, it broke. No problems so far. Easy unit to operate and very reliable. Also like the lower price than the first one I bought. Excellent print quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqulyn S. Brokaw

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer - I would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I've had the printer for about two weeks now. 100% satisfied so far. Easy setup, all functions work well, very happy with it and would recommend it to anyone. I have a number of HP multi functions over the years and this is their best product yet in my opinion. We'll see the how the ink lasts.
customer_reviews.author: M3XTC

customer_reviews.title: Setting this up is a NIGHTMARE!
customer_reviews.text: I spent 3 1/2 hrs working with the set up documents provided trying to get the printer working. After many attempts to solve the problem of, "Alignment failed" I spent an additional 1 1/2 hrs with HP tech support on the phone. Total time, 5 hrs and HP is shipping me new printer heads. Poor quality machine!
customer_reviews.author: Chocolate

customer_reviews.title: Lesson Learned
customer_reviews.text: I was very hesitant to buy this given all the horror stories and 1-star reviews. But cnet raved about it and there were also a lot of 5-star reviews so I thought I would give it try. Couldn't even get the test page to print! First it started giving me some nonsense about a printer head not being installed and then it said there was a paper jam. After several rounds of rebooting the printer finally got it to recognize the printer head, but never did resolve the issue of the mythical paper jam. Didn't even bother with hp tech support after seeing all reviews about how worthless they are. Sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Kollman

customer_reviews.title: Pro 8500 All in one printer
customer_reviews.text: At first it worked well, for the last six months it would come on but the code would be paper jam, or it would not print. I have had it checked out for paper jam.......no jam.
customer_reviews.author: berylstrachan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer
customer_reviews.text: An excellent and reliable machine with more bells and whistles than I expected. Like other HP printers, this one requires expensive ink cartridges and does NOT allow any printing activity or even scanning (!) to files if ANY of the ink cartridges get low -- and the only reason it comes up one star short on my scale of max satisfaction. But given I bought this machine deeply marked down, I couldn't otherwise be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Associates account

customer_reviews.title: Good for home use. Not for office.
customer_reviews.text: Very slow printer and then it does a system maintenance specifically when you are doing copies. You can't cancel the system maintenance so you just have to wait until it finishes. Very frustrating printer if you need it for work.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: great features limited by wireless connection
customer_reviews.text: Installation was fairly easy and the features are great. My wireless connection is limiting speed and at times things won't print at all. Plan to connect to nearest cpu and only use wireless connection for laptop.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hyde

customer_reviews.title: Excellent multipurpose printer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent multipurpose printer. Nice looking and not overly large. Has many many features that really help to create an easy-to-use home office environment. Easy to set up and run. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pathfinder

customer_reviews.title: Terrible High Pitched Noise
customer_reviews.text: I just opened up my brand new all-in-one, plugged it in, and OUCH... loud hissing noise coming from the power supply. The only thing that helps is turning it off. I now have a headache after having this thing on for the TWENTY minutes it takes to calibrate. Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Oops they did it again..
customer_reviews.text: I have always like HP products/printers, I have had others, I keep coming back, I feel bang for the buck, they have the best product on the market. This is a great setup for my home office, quality, speed, quietness, and it looks good too, without taking up a lot of room, and duplex printing, most excellent for saving paper.. I have nothing bad to say about this product at this time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: good printer
customer_reviews.text: nice printer with alot of features, wireless connection have not been able to setup but installed wired lan connection good, good printer for more than just basic printing
customer_reviews.author: Terry Enright

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this printer and I haven't had any issues with it! A great printer!!
customer_reviews.author: Abbey Wilkins

customer_reviews.title: hp officejet pro 8500
customer_reviews.text: have setup for two weeks now--overall very happy--setup not too bad for someone techno weak and not too bad to navigate---the touchscreen works---for my small office a tad too noisy but livable
customer_reviews.author: herbert

customer_reviews.title: Good HP Printer
customer_reviews.text: It's a good printer, does a lot of cool functions. One thing I had a problem was with my laptop setting up... My laptop was running windows 7 32bit, and i guess the printer didn't like it, so I had to install windows 7 64bit.
customer_reviews.author: dana bowyer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.  Great Features.  Good Price
customer_reviews.text: I needed a wireless printer. When I looked in the stores I liked this one but it was out of my price range. Needless to say I was quite pleased when, on Amazon, it was IN my price range. Couldnt't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Scott D. Sparrow

customer_reviews.title: Good review
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer, very easy to setup and does everything as advertised but more. This is by far the best printer I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pieper

customer_reviews.title: Good printer - no problems so far- own it for 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Very nice printer. No issues so far. We have bought it 3 years back at Costco. We use its wired/wireless feature. Print speed is great. The cartridges are a bit expensive. Maybe that's how it is for new printers.
customer_reviews.author: Sharath Anmangandla

customer_reviews.title: HP Officejet Pro 8500 Wireless
customer_reviews.text: So far I have not used all of the functions but as to the ones I have used this printer's performance has been excellent.
customer_reviews.author: William L. Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: All I expected
customer_reviews.text: I think the title says everything. I'd like to detach the easy setup and the printing speed. I have a HP C7280 too and I think the Officejet Pro 8500 is better.
customer_reviews.author: Jose A

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer!!
customer_reviews.text: I have it for more than a year and had no problem at all. I'm using it for a home based business and I love it. You will not get a better printer for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Maurinic

customer_reviews.title: HP printer
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a great printer. Easy to setup. We are using a PC and a Mac computer with the printer with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Peck

customer_reviews.title: HP Officejet Pro 8500 Wireless All-In-One Printer
customer_reviews.text: Needed replacement for older HP all-in-one (G55) that went TU. Researched features, prices, utility and user friendliness. Selected. It arrived quickly, was extremely easy and quick to set up and integrate into network. Fast printing, excellent scanning. I am extremely pleased with unit.
customer_reviews.author: Boogeyman

customer_reviews.title: HP  8500  Wireless  Printer
customer_reviews.text: Saved $ over local office supply outlets. Extremely happy with wireless feature. Still learning about some of its other attributes, but overall would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Deck

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy including the wireless. The fax component failed within the first week of use. I chose to replace the unit. This was easy to do and I had a replacement within a couple of weeks. It has been working flawlesy for the past 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: J. Behm

customer_reviews.title: jbticaboo
customer_reviews.text: havn't used it much, but so far, find it as advertised. am happy with my new printer
customer_reviews.author: jbticaboo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Printer A+
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Fast, error-free, wireless networked, easy to use and manage, Fax and copy are simple. Fax has one touch on feature, unlike other printers. Ohh yea, its also aesthetically beautiful. Cons: paper feeder is inconvenient. I recommend this printer for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Vartan Abulyan

customer_reviews.title: Expectations Met
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a new wireless printer (all-in-one) that featured a document feeder primarily for scanning multi-page docs to save to file. I did a good bit of online research before selecting this one & so far I am pleased with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: zzggyy

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy that I purchased this printer. It does everything with high quality and I would recommend to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Tk like

customer_reviews.title: HP Officejet Pro 8500
customer_reviews.text: Overall a nice printer, but seems to have some issues with paper jams. It seems that it will sometimes pull a finished sheet back into the printer and then jam.
customer_reviews.author: dab

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Wireless Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best printer I have ever owned and price was actually reasonable especially through Amazon. 5 STARS
customer_reviews.author: David Brinkman

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap construction and printing quality. Not very user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Reggie

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: Printer does what they say and ink prices are some of the lowest in the industry. Good quality printer for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Sent back.  Didn't perform any tasks as promised, no consistency.
customer_reviews.text: Did nor perform any task consistently. Very complicated to hook up and operate. Not user friendly. Did not rate all qualities because they never worked!
customer_reviews.author: P. Pilliod

product_meta.title: HP Officejet Pro 8500 Wireless All-in-One Printer
product_meta.description:
The HP Officejet Pro 8500 Wireless All-in-one Printer comes with built-in Wireless Printing and Wired Networking. The Two sided printing saves paper with add-on features like memory card slots, Color LCD Screen, 4*6 Color Photo Printing, High Capacity Paper Tray and Auto Document Feeder.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Want a multifunction color printer that offers the convenience of wireless networking? Our Officejet Pro 8500 is right for all your small-office printing, faxing, copying, and scanning. You'll get professional-quality color at up to 50% lower color cost per page and using less energy than laser printers. Plus you can scan photos and documents (up to legal size) directly to folders¿without a PC¿using our Direct Digital Filing feature. 



WHY BUY?
 * Legal-size scanning
   
   
 * 3.4" interactive touchscreen
   
   
 * Professional color for up to 50% lower cost per page and less energy use than lasers1

EnlargeFUNCTIONS

FEATURES
EnlargeBuilt-in Wireless Printing
Print from any room without using cables


Built-in Wired Networking
Share your printer with multiple people


Two-sided Printing
Save paper by printing on both sides automatically


Memory Card Slots
Print photos without using a PC


Color LCD Screen
Edit photos and/or manage your printer easily


4 x 6 Color Photo Printing
Print brilliant photos for albums or to enhance business documents 


High-capacity Paper Tray
Refill paper less often with a tray that holds 250 sheets or more 


Auto Document Feeder
Fax, scan and copy multiple pages automatically


INCLUDED NOT INCLUDED

SPECIFICATIONS
Print Speed Maximum speeds of 35 pages per minute black, 34 ppm color2


Fax Up to 125-page fax memory, up to 99 speed dial numbers 


Scan Resolution up to 4800-dpi optical; maximum scan size 8.5" x 14" 


CopyReduce/enlarge 25%–400%


Paper Handling 3" x 5" to 8.5" x 14"; up to 15,000 pages per month 


Wireless Wireless 802.11b/g 



REMEMBER ORIGINAL HP INK AND PAPER SAVE MONEY when you choose high-capacity cartridges over standard ones
RECOMMENDED HP INK3

940 1,000 pages 940XL 2,200 pages 


940 900 pages 940XL 1,400 pages 


940 900 pages 940XL 1,400 pages 


940 900 pages 940XL 1,400 pages RECOMMENDED HP PAPER

HP Brochure & Flyer Paper


HP Presentation Paper


HP Bright White Inkjet Paper 

MORE INFORMATION 

Datasheet (PDF) 

Product Overview 

WHICH HP ALL-IN-ONE IS RIGHT FOR YOU? 
Compare the good, better and best, side-by-side 

See Comparison Chart 



 1. Majority of color laser all-in-ones under $600, June 2008, OJ Pro with highest-capacity cartridges. Energy use based on HP testing using the ENERGY STAR® program’s TEC test method criteria. For details, see www.hp.com/go/officejet
 2. After first page; see www.hp.com/go/inkjetprinter for details.
 3. Page yield values are approximate, actual yield depends on printer and specific use; for more information visit www.hpshopping.com
feature_bullets: All In One Printer with Wireless 802.11g Networking
Laser Quality Speed Up to 15 ppm Black/Up to 11 ppm Color and Maximum 35 ppm Black/34 ppm Color
3.4 in Touchscreen LCD Display and Up to 2400 x 4800 dpi Scan Resolution
128 MB Memory and 348 MHz Processor Speed
250-Sheet Paper Tray, 50 Sheet Automatic Document Feeder, and Automatic Two Sided Printing
